oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Scarritt College, circa 1929
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dedicated in March 1928, Scarritt College remains one of architect Henry C. Hibbs' signature designs in the collegiate gothic style. Hibbs was awarded a gold medal for his work on Scarritt and was recognized in the December 1929 issue of Southern Architect and Building News, for which this photo was likely taken. Forms part of the Henry C. Hibbs Papers. 1 photograph : b&w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hibbs, Henry C. (Clossen), 1883-1949
Scarritt College for Christian Workers--History; Scarritt-Bennett Center--History
